title: Whitey Bulger mugshot comes down at Savin Hill restaurant after backlash
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Savin Bar + Kitchen removed Whitey Bulger's mugshot after backlash from local groups and national attention.
The mugshots of mobsters Whitey Bulger and Stephen Flemmi were part of a renovation featured on a TV show.
National coverage and local criticism led the restaurant to replace the photos with historic Boston building images.

title: Have you seen snowliage — that wild mix of fall leaves and winter snow?
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Snowliage is a rare blend of fall foliage and early snowfall seen in regions like Vermont.
Photographer Phil Bobrow captures snowliage images in Fayston, Vermont, sharing the spectacle on social media.
Snowliage occurs when leaves haven't dropped and temperatures are just right for snowfall, creating a unique seasonal display.

title: Lynn man convicted of killing girlfriend whose body was found in Saugus marsh
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Bruce Maiben, 48, from Lynn, sentenced to life in prison for the 2021 murder of Sherell Pringle.
Sherell Pringle's body was discovered in the Saugus marsh, reported missing after a date with Maiben.
Maiben was initially charged with larceny and evidence tampering before being convicted of first-degree murder.

title: Debt holders take over downtown Boston office building sold below value
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: 99 Bedford St. office building in downtown Boston sold for $19 million at auction, below assessed value.
Chevron Partners LLC and Capital Hall Partners ultimate bidders, plan to maintain the building as office space.
City of Boston was runner-up bidder; hoped to convert the building into housing as part of downtown revitalization.

title: Bruins’ Fraser Minten is starting to see his stock rise in Marco Sturm’s system
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Fraser Minten has earned a promotion to the Boston Bruins' top line, joining David Pastrnak and Marat Khusnutdinov.
Minten recorded a primary assist in the Bruins' 4-3 shootout victory over the Islanders, helping to tie the game in the third period.
Under head coach Marco Sturm, Minten has averaged over 15 minutes of ice time with four points in his last five games.

title: All the new movies and TV shows streaming in November
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: New streaming releases in November 2025 feature 'Materialists' on HBO Max and 'Fantastic Four: First Steps' on Disney+.
'Stranger Things' Season 5 and Guillermo del Toro's 'Frankenstein' premiere on Netflix on November 26 and November 7 respectively.
November streaming content focuses on holiday and popular 2025 films across platforms like Netflix, Hulu, and Apple TV.

title: Tom Brady refuses to pick sides in Patriots Buccaneers matchup
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Tom Brady declined to pick a side in the upcoming Patriots vs. Buccaneers game.
Brady ranked the Patriots 6th and Buccaneers 3rd in his NFL top 10 after strong starts.
He praised the Patriots' performance, highlighting their six-game winning streak and calling them a 'classic New England' team.

title: South Shore woman loses over $30,000 in arrest warrant scam
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: A Weymouth woman lost $31,600 to a scammer posing as a lieutenant with a fake arrest warrant.
The victim wired payments totaling $31,600 through bank transfers and Apple Pay over a two-day period.
Norfolk County Sheriff warned residents not to believe calls from alleged authorities requesting money.

title: 29-year-old driver killed in crash that closed Route 1 Wednesday morning
author: John Waller
bullets: 29-year-old driver killed in crash on Route 1 in Norwood before 8 a.m. Wednesday.
47-year-old male driver involved in the crash hospitalized with non-life-threatening injuries.
Route 1 reopened shortly after 11 a.m.; crash under investigation by authorities.

title: Boston police now required to wear nametags under new contract extension
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Boston police will now wear nametags under a new contract extension with the Boston Police Patrolmen's Association.
The contract extension includes wage increases, free gym access, and enhances evaluation systems for Boston police officers.
Mayor Michelle Wu emphasizes transparency and public trust as key benefits of the new nametag requirement for officers.
